mPueiPBD29fMgPCNl_xKGw.text: Understated service, friendly but not cloying. Adequate wine list. Small choice of gins, more whiskeys. Chic look and chic crowd. Nice departure from Scottish pubs and whiskey joints. Bread comes with pesto/lovage/mint butter. Delightful Gaspacho arrives as an empty bowl except for a spoonful of ricotta, a cherry tomato, and a sliver of fennel. The waiter adds a thin broth on it, then you have to stir the ricotta in. The duck breast, though the waitress didn't ask is a perfect medium rare, unsliced, but accompanied with an adequate steak knife. Spring roll, filled with cabbage and nuts is a fine addition as are the blackberries and carrot puree. Paired with the Mourvedre/Syrah from S. Africa was a great idea. The sea bass is amazingly good - every bite. The tiny potato beignets are a nice touch.  Scallops with chorizo arrived without chorizo. Waitress says they are wee bits.  We couldn't finish the sea bass and sadly left no room for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse with mango sorbet
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gaspacho with ricotta
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Magret de Canard with spring rolls, carrot purée, and blackberries

5GHmcqxD1KepNphKeJjK9A.text: Avoid this restaurant! Ate here with my family last night. It was a fairly cool evening. Regardless, this restaurant was unbelievably hot with no airflow. It's so bad that the restaurant has a humid, gym locker room smell to it right when you step in the door. The wait staff refused to open the back door to the restaurant to get some airflow even though all patrons were complaining. This restaurant has received a lot of hype so I had high expectations for the food but found it to taste just average. I have a dairy allergy and was very frustrated when I was trying to order because our waiter did not take my allergy seriously.

cfQ--bOOhcueZt57894l6Q.text: Run, don't walk to Lovage before it gets discovered.   We didn't have a reservation anywhere and went at the suggestion of our concierge.   It is  block from North Bridge and 1/2 block off the Royal Mile.  Quiet, modern decor. A very intimate space.   Every dish we had was excellent. Service was spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

96QlYa1NeitwWHh9tD0UCw.text: My family enjoyed this restaurant tremendously. The food was excellent, the staff was attentive, and the kitchen was very accommodating. GO THERE!!

3p4edHfLH1gtSi0hcVG8yA.text: Lovely vibe but service a bit uneven. About 1/4 of my medium rare steak was well done, but portions are generous so I wasn't left hungry by not eating it. Would recommend and would definitely go back next time I'm in town.

yQakIhCmZcRVynA5q1hLOA.text: Lovely little restaurant with good food. Among three mains(duck, pork and hake),hake was the best. I loved it although my friends thought it just so-so.

photos.caption: Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zN2ulwkdsl-hWsX60_RWpg.text: Really wonderful, imaginative food, friendly staff, quiet, intimate atmosphere.  My husband and I were  really impressed with the food here. We come from Berkeley, California which is foodie heaven, and both of us are fairly good cooks.  The scallop starter surprised us by pairing blackberries with scallops, which I would never have imagined as compatible flavors. It was delicious, and my one minor tweet would be pulling back on the sweetness of the berries and adding some acidic element, like lemon or a vinaigrette. My husband loved the lamb and I had the sea bass. Both dishes were flavorful and perfectly cooked. I ordered the avocado ice cream and lemon cheesecake with crumble.  The ice cream was incredibly creamy, but lacked some sweetness (for my tastes) and the lemon dessert was really mouth-watering, except that it seemed to be semi-frozen and impossible to cut until it had thawed. My husband liked the rice pudding but could have skipped the granola crumble, but that's just personal taste. Overall it was a great meal, very special, and I would not hesitate to go back again.

GuNGIqMlw2jfi99UlCUx6Q.text: Lovage is a hidden gem. We couldn't get in on a Saturday night so we made reservations for Sunday. It was the best meal I had in Edinburgh. The pork neck was very tender and tasty.  My husband had the roast lamb which was infused with rosemary and fell off the bone.  Service was attentive.  Prices were reasonable for the quality of food from an extremely talented chef!

anCrhPRen0uAC6MrtYQnZw.text: We enjoyed a quiet and lovely dinner at Lovage. Appetizers were excellent and the entrees tasty and filling. Our server was friendly and professional. Overall, a nice experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb shank
Photo of Lovage - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ribeye

W-WGyJBLzlDuQpJhILESyQ.text: Very friendly service, great starters and exciting menu all up. Steak tartare was Maria's first attempt at that and it all disappeared, cucumber soup was "like Babcia makes it" and my sweetbread melted in the tongue. Only reason this is not a 5 star is neither of us much cared for he risotto, rice had a kind of gritty texture to it.

ZKh8eRsA8BeBHMz4mPRoxw.text: Nice, unpretentious small place with simply decorated rooms. Excellent menu, esp. the pork neck w/plums & red cabbage and sublime gooseberry cheesecake. Server was lovely and helpful. What's not to like?

1bzjv93VDE8oJ2bIRJquhA.text: I had the steak and also at the table the risotto and chicken were ordered. All fantastic. Small selection of desserts but overall loved it, I'd come back.

QqHKZGl58pHOHDVOAzlKNA.text: Nice setting.  French-like service. Food excellent with great presentation.  Reasonable prices.  Small somewhat tight spaces between tables.  Highly recommendedBes.  Best meal we had while in Old Town.

PUwz7Zj7CPAKiG_aGEg0dg.text: Small and scrumptious restaurant. We enjoyed an anniversary dinner with a scallop appetizer, venison and chocolate dessert that was elegant and tasty. Service responsive and appropriate. When we asked, we got suggestions. Highly recommend.
